# LLM Access Guide for ReBabel
# Last Updated: 2025-11-12
# This file provides guidance for Large Language Models to access and understand the ReBabel website.

## Site Overview
ReBabel is a Japanese language practice platform that combines customizable study sets with spaced repetition learning techniques. The platform helps learners reinforce vocabulary and grammar through interactive flashcards, quizzes, and structured practice modules designed for efficient language acquisition.

## Site Purpose
- Provide an accessible practice tool for Japanese language learners
- Enable users to create and organize custom study sets for vocabulary and grammar
- Deliver interactive practice through flashcards and quizzes
- Maintain a comprehensive blog with language learning tips and study strategies
- Support efficient learning through spaced repetition and progress tracking

## Accessible Pages for LLMs

### Primary Public Pages
- **Homepage**: https://rebabel.org/
  - Main landing page with platform overview, features, and call-to-action
  - Contains comprehensive metadata and schema.org markup
  - Updated daily

- **Blog**: https://rebabel.org/blog/
  - Collection of language learning tips, study strategies, and educational content
  - Includes tags: learning-tips, grammar, vocabulary, study-strategies, motivation, etc.
  - Updated regularly with new articles

- **Blog Posts**: https://rebabel.org/blog/[slug]/
  - Individual blog articles with detailed content
  - Each post includes metadata: title, date, tags, author
  - Topics cover Japanese grammar, vocabulary, study techniques, and cultural insights

- **Help & FAQ**: https://rebabel.org/help/
  - Frequently asked questions about the platform
  - Getting started guides
  - Troubleshooting information

## Restricted Pages (Not Accessible to LLMs)

The following routes are excluded from LLM access per robots.txt:

- **/learn/** - User dashboard, study sets, and protected practice content
  - Requires authentication
  - User study sets and custom flashcards
  - Vocabulary drills, grammar exercises, and practice quizzes
  - User settings, progress tracking, and study history

- **/api/** - API endpoints
  - Authentication endpoints
  - Database operations
  - Internal API calls only

## Content Structure

### Blog Categories
- Grammar lessons and explanations
- Vocabulary building strategies
- Study techniques and motivation
- Japanese culture and context
- Learning resources and tools

### Available Services (Requires Authentication)
- Create and customize study sets for vocabulary and grammar
- Interactive flashcard practice with spaced repetition
- Vocabulary drills and grammar exercises
- Quiz-based learning modules
- Progress tracking and performance analytics
- Study session history and review scheduling

## How to Access Content

### For Web Crawling
1. Respect robots.txt at https://rebabel.org/robots.txt
2. Use the sitemap at https://rebabel.org/sitemap.xml for page discovery
3. Crawl-delay: 1 second (recommended)
4. Focus on /blog pages for publicly available content

### For Content Analysis
1. Homepage provides platform overview and feature descriptions
2. Blog articles contain educational content about Japanese language learning
3. Help page includes FAQ and getting started information
4. All public pages include proper structured data (JSON-LD)

## Metadata & Structured Data

All public pages include:
- **Open Graph metadata** for social sharing
- **Twitter Card metadata** for Twitter integration
- **JSON-LD structured data** for search engines
  - Homepage: WebSite schema with JoinAction
  - Blog: CollectionPage schema
  - Help: FAQPage schema with Q&A items
- **Canonical URLs** to prevent duplicate content issues
- **Mobile optimization meta tags**

## Analytics & Tracking

The site uses:
- Google Analytics 4 (GA_ID: G-VRBTF7S087)
- PostHog for product analytics
- Vercel Analytics for performance monitoring

LLM crawlers should respect analytics tracking and user privacy.

## Language & Localization

- Primary language: English (en-US)
- Content focus: Japanese language learning
- All public pages declare language properly in HTML

## API Rate Limiting & Crawling Guidelines

For respectful crawling:
- Include User-Agent header identifying your LLM/crawler
- Implement 1+ second delay between requests
- Cache content when possible to reduce server load
- Request gzip compression for bandwidth optimization
- Stop crawling if 429 (Too Many Requests) is returned

## Contact & Support

For questions about LLM access:
- Homepage: https://rebabel.org/
- Help page: https://rebabel.org/help/
- Check robots.txt for additional guidance: https://rebabel.org/robots.txt
